newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks lower in livelier OTC market.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks lower in livelier OTC market.

text.p: Following is the closing report for Croatia's over-the-counter market in Varazdin, including its Osijek outpost, for Wednesday, October 23.
* Of 10 active stocks six fell, one rose and three remained unchanged.
* Volume higher at 3,254 units, turnover also up at 177,304 German marks.
* 10-stock VIN index fell 3.97 percent to 9,013 points.
* Biggest loser was Istrian hotelier Arenaturist from Pula which lost 15.38 percent to close at 55 marks.
* Top gainer was shipper Tankerska Plovidba from Zadar, gaining 25 percent to close at 100 marks.
* The most actively traded issue was textile firm Varteks with 1548 shares traded, closing at 25 marks -- 13.79 percent down.
